result.execSummary:
The defendant Monica M. Hooper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No contact with D. Taggart, A. Taggart and/or R. Rice directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 11:52 a.m. Defendant Monica M. Hooper in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement recited by DA Blader. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed by DA Blader. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation - Conditions: 45 days WCJ - Huber, No GT, No CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than 1/2/2015, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, NC w/D. Taggart, A. Taggart and/or R. Rice, DNA sample and surcharge, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 18, 2014 at 11:30 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi is requesting a P/S date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on October 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi requests additional status.  Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: 14CF-104 and 14CM-35 - Both Cases Called @ 2:42 PM: Defendant Monica M. Hooper in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD:  Does not technically represent Def as to SEHR 14CM-35.  Def intends to proceed on SEHR it is believed that the maximum sentence has already been served.  14CM-35 SEHR:  Will proceed pro se today - Def admits receipt of Rev Ord and Warrant.  No factual corrections offered by Def.  Court believes 27 days credit to be applied.  ADA agrees and will argue for time served.  No statement offered.  The Court:  Recognizes that maximum period of time has already been served.  Imposes 30 days WCJ - credit for 27 days of time served with GT sentence is time served. Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of time limits for pre-lim hrg.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
